newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX natgas called mostly steady ahead of weekend.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX natgas called mostly steady ahead of weekend.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures were expected to open mostly unchanged Friday following a steady ACCESS session and a steady open on Kansas City Board of Trade, industry sources said.
July over-the-counter trade ranged from $2.24 to $2.26 after settling Thursday at $2.25 per million British thermal units.
On ACCESS, July last traded one cent lower at $2.24.
"You're just looking at some retracement levels at $2.22 and $2.185," one trader said.
Further support in July was pegged around $2.09. Resistance was still seen at $2.37-2.38 and then at the contract high of $2.44.

In Thursday's cash, June Gulf Coast prices lost more than five cents to the mid-to-high $2.20s. June Midcon gas slipped a similar amount to about $2.10. New York city gate June gas tumbled more than 10 cents to about $2.50.
On KCBT, July gas futures opened only 0.2 cent lower at $2.105.
